III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two youth got into a physical altercation and a staff member put
one youth into a physical restraint and escorted the youth back
into their room. The youth was upset due to the other youth
sneaking into their room and forcing them to perform oral sex.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 30, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A reported he is aware of why he is being interviewed and
explained Youth B had “raped” him. When asked to explain, Youth
A reported in November 2024, he had gone into Youth B’s
bedroom after Staff 2 completed a room check. He reported he
first went into Youth B’s room because he wanted to see Youth
B’s shoe collection. Youth A reported Youth B began to look him
up him down and asked him to have sex with him. He reported
when he told him no, Youth B threatened to beat him up if he
didn’t. Youth A reported he then performed oral sex on Youth B for
a few minutes. He reported Staff 2 had come back down to do
room checks in less than ten minutes. Youth A reported he did not
want to get in trouble so when he heard Staff 2 coming, he hid in
the corner of Youth B’s room and then when he heard him knock
on his bedroom door, he snuck out of Youth B’s bedroom. Youth A
reported he acted like he was coming from the bathroom and told
Staff 2 that was where he was. He reported he did not tell Staff 2
about the situation that occurred because he feared Youth B.
Youth A reported he got into a physical fight with Youth B on
December 20, 2024. He reported the fight started because Youth
B was asking him if they were “cool” with one another and Youth A
remembered the events that took place in November 2024 and got
upset. Youth A reported at first Staff 1 was not intervening in the
situation but then later restrained Youth A after he was punching
the TV. He reported Staff 1 escorted him away from Youth B and
2

stayed with him to process the situation which is when he reported
about the sexual assault. Youth A reported the only other person
that was there was Supervisor and no other youth saw the fight.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 30, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth B reported on December 20, 2024, Youth A continued to
talk negatively about Youth B’s family which made him upset. He
reported Youth A attempted to fight him and Staff 1 had separated
them. Due to Youth A’s aggression, Staff 1 restrained him and
removed Youth A from the area to calm down. Youth B reported
Staff 1 stayed with Youth A while he sat with Supervisor. He
reported he then started to hear rumors that Youth A was starting
rumors about him being inappropriate with him. Youth B reported
on November 10, 2024, Youth A had asked him to come to see
his shoes when they were supposed to be going to bed. He
reported after Staff 2 had completed a room check, Youth A came
out of his room to see Youth B’s shoes and tried to hide in Youth
B’s room. Youth B reported less than ten minutes later, Staff 2
completed another room check and when Youth A heard Staff 1
knock on his door, he snuck out of Youth B’s room and into the
hallway. Youth B reported nothing inappropriate happened in the
bedroom, he denied ever touching Youth A or doing anything
sexual with him. He reported Youth A had made allegations about
other youth in the past being inappropriate with him, but nothing
was found. Youth B reported Youth A just likes to have attention
on him. He reported staff are completing room checks at random
times and this seems to occur less than every ten to fifteen
minutes.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 30, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 reported he was the staff member involved when Youth A
and Youth B were in a physical fight with one another on
December 20, 2024. He reported the night previous, Youth A
continued to make negative comments to Youth B about his family
members. On December 20, 2024, around lunchtime, Youth A
was making threatening comments toward Youth B. Staff 1
reported he continued to redirect Youth A’s negative comments
and encouraged Youth B to ignore the situation. He reported he
played a game with Youth B and Youth A continued antagonizing
Youth B. When the game was over, Staff 1 tried to process with
Youth A about what was making him upset and Youth A refused.
Staff 1 reported Youth A made verbal threats to Youth B and then
grabbed Youth B. Youth B then punched Youth A and Staff 1
attempted to go in between the two youth. Youth B listened to the
3

redirects and went with Supervisor to calm down. Youth A
continued to be physically aggressive and was put into a one-
person Aegis hold due to being physically assaultive towards staff
and peers. Staff 1 reported he put Youth A into this hold and then
escorted him to the hallways to give space from Youth B. He
reported he stayed with Youth A to process the situation. Staff 1
reported this was when Youth A disclosed Youth B forcing Youth
A to perform oral sex on him. He reported prior to the disclosure,
while in the hold, Youth A continued to talk about his fear of losing
his home pass due to the fight and blamed Youth B for this
happening.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 30, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 2 reported he was the staff performing room checks on
November 10, 2024, when he discovered Youth A had snuck into
Youth B’s bedroom. He reported he had opened all the youth’s
bedroom doors for bedtime around 8pm. Staff 2 reported less than
ten minutes later he completed room checks and Youth B was
sitting at his desk. He reported he then went to check on Youth A
and there was no immediate response. Staff 2 reported he
knocked on the door and used a flashlight to look around but
could not see the figure on the bed. He reported he stepped into
the room to further investigate and found a pile of clothes on the
bed and Youth A to not be in his room. Within a few seconds of
Staff 2 going into Youth A’s room, Youth A had emerged from the
hallway. Staff 2 asked Youth A where he had been, and he
reported he had been in the bathroom. Youth A reported he made
a bet with Youth B that he could get away with staying in the
bathroom overnight without the staff noticing. Staff 2 reported he
would have heard the bathroom door open if that was a true story
and suspected Youth A had gone to Youth B’s room. He reported
when he talked with Youth B, he reported Youth A had come into
his room to see his shoes and when they heard Staff 2 coming
down the hall, Youth A hid in Youth B’s room because he wanted
to hang out and not get in trouble. Staff 2 reported this incident to
leadership and completed an incident report. He reported the next
day he processed with both youths privately about the incident
and neither disclosed anything inappropriate happening.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 30, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported on December 20, 2024, she was in her office,
which is located in the milieu of the unit, when she heard Youth A
and Youth B getting into a verbal argument. She reported she
watched Staff 1 complete verbal de-escalation and get between
4

both youth when they began to physically fight. Supervisor
reported she watched Staff 1 put Youth A into a one-person hold
due to him being physically assaultive towards others. She
reported she brought Youth B into her office to process the
situation while Staff 1 processed with Youth A. Supervisor
reported Youth B stated he punched Youth A because Youth A
continued to make statements that he was going have sex with
Youth B’s deceased mother. She reported Youth A has been
struggling on the unit with all peers and trying to get them in
trouble. Supervisor reported Youth A and Youth B were good
friends until Youth B started to hang out with the other peers that
Youth A does not like. She reported Staff 1 told her about the
allegations Youth A made about Youth B of forcing him to perform
oral sex. Supervisor reported he disclosed it was during the time
that Staff 1 caught him hiding in Youth B’s room. She reported
when that incident was reviewed internally both youths never
disclosed anything sexual occurring and they were in the room for
less than six minutes.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 23, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Administrator reported he received the phone call when Youth A
got into a fight with Youth B and then made the allegation about
Youth B performing oral sex on him. He reported Youth A
disclosed that this incident occurred on November 10, 2024.
Administrator reported Staff 2 had completed an incident report on
November 10, 2024, because Youth A was not present in his
room when he did a room check and after investigating found
Youth A had gone into Youth B’s bedroom. Administrator reported
Youth A and Youth B never disclosed any sexual activity occurring
between them. He reported the video footage was reviewed. Staff
2 had completed room checks in variable intervals that did not
exceed fifteen minutes and followed proper procedures for a
critical incident. Administrator reported he reviewed the incident of
the fight and debriefed with both Youth A and Youth B. It was
found Youth A was making negative remarks about Youth B’s
mother who passed away and Youth A continued to antagonize
Youth B. Administrator reported Staff 1 attempted to use verbal
de-escalation, but Youth A did not respond to this and attempted
to physically assault Youth B. He reported Staff 1 had placed
Youth A into a one-person restraint hold and escorted him out of
the milieu into the hallway. Administrator reported Staff 1 stayed
with Youth A in the hallway to process the situation, which is
where these allegations came about. He reported Staff 1 followed
proper protocol in this situation.
5

Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 11/10/2024 in Youth A and Youth B’s bedroom
hallway was reviewed on 12/23/2024 with MDHHS Worker and
Administrator. The video starts at 8:00PM, Staff 2 opened
bedroom doors for Youth A and Youth B and then traveled down
the next hallway. At 8:03PM, Youth B sticks his head out of his
bedroom door and looked down the hallway. Youth A had exited
his room and was standing in the hallway. At 8:04PM, Youth A
went into Youth B’s room. At 8:10PM, Staff 2 entered the hallway
and began to look into bedrooms. He is seen looking into Youth
B’s room with a flashlight and then goes to look into Youth A’s
room and opened the door. At 8:12PM, Youth B poked his head
out of his bedroom, while Staff 2 was still near Youth A’s room.
Youth A ran out of Youth B’s room and walked up behind Staff 2
to go back into his bedroom. There was no sound on this video.
There is no video footage of 12/20/24 of the fight between Youth A
and Youth B. This is because Youth A had broken the video
camera in the milieu area where the fight occurred.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Incident Report Dated November 10, 2024,
completed by Staff 2- The incident report was consistent
with Staff 2’s interview.
- Facility Incident Report Dated December 20, 2024,
completed by Staff 1- The incident report was consistent
with Staff 1’s interview. This noted proper restraint
technique used.
- MISACWIS Incident Report 202870239 Dated December
20, 2024 completed by Staff 1- This incident reported is
consistent with the facility incident report and Staff 1’s
interview. Proper restraint technique was documented.
- Facility Behavior Management Procedure dated July 3,
2024- “The use of physical management should be
employed in the manner trained and directed by the AEFIS
model and only in moments where there is clear and
imminent risk of serious harm to the client or others and
other less restrictive means of intervention are ineffective.”
- Residential Staffing Ratios Procedure dated July 3,
2024- “Direct care staff members are required to maintain
supervision of youths at all times except when youth are in
their individual sleeping rooms or bedrooms.”
- Bed Checks Procedures dated July 3, 2024- “Bed
checks must be conducted at variable intervals, with no
6

more than 15 minutes between checks. When completing a
bed check staff members are expected to physically view
the client’s person ‘body or breath’ and confirm they are
safe.”
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 had a disciplinary
action within his human resource file in 2019 due to a
medication error which he was provided verbal coaching.
He is up to date on all of his required trainings including
AEGIS recertification training on March 25, 2024.
- Staff 2 Human Resource File- Staff 2 has had a verbal
warning provided to him due to attendance issues which he
was provided coaching for. He is up to date on all of his
required trainings including training on Bed Check
Procedure on December 16, 2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance of providing adequate
supervision and protection of Youth A and Youth B. Within
interviews and video review on November 10, 2024, Staff 2 did
catch Youth A going into Youth B’s room but completed the room
checks within a timely manner as there was only six minutes
between the last room checks. Per interviews, Staff 1 was able to
safely separate Youth A and Youth B away from one another
when they were in a fight on December 20, 2024.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
